quiz.question: What is the main focus of software design and implementation?
quiz.answer: Developing an executable software system
quiz.suggestion: Review the definition of software design and implementation

quiz.question: What does the 'Build or Buy' decision involve?
options: Choosing between developing custom software or buying off-the-shelf systems
Deciding whether to use open-source or proprietary tools
quiz.answer: Choosing between developing custom software or buying off-the-shelf systems
quiz.suggestion: Recall the meaning of Build or Buy in software development

quiz.question: Which of the following is a common activity in object-oriented design processes?
options: Define the context and modes of use of the system
quiz.answer: Define the context and modes of use of the system
quiz.suggestion: Review the common activities in object-oriented design processes

quiz.question: What is a system context model?
options: A structural model that shows other systems in the environment
A dynamic model of user interactions
A model of the system's internal architecture
A model of the system's data flow
quiz.answer: A structural model that shows other systems in the environment
quiz.suggestion: Recall the definition of a system context model

quiz.question: What does an interaction model represent?
options: How the system interacts with its environment during use
The static structure of system components
The hardware configuration of the system
The data storage schema of the system
quiz.answer: How the system interacts with its environment during use
quiz.suggestion: Review the definition of an interaction model

quiz.question: What is the purpose of architectural design in the development process?
options: To identify major components and their interactions
To write the source code for each module
To create the user interface design
quiz.answer: To identify major components and their interactions
quiz.suggestion: Recall the role of architectural design

quiz.question: Which approach is NOT commonly used for object class identification?
options: Grammatical approach based on natural language
quiz.answer: Random selection
quiz.suggestion: Review the methods for identifying object classes

quiz.question: What are the levels of software reuse?
options: Abstraction, object, component, and system levels
Code, design, test, and documentation levels
Hardware, software, network, and data levels
Individual, team, organizational, and community levels
quiz.answer: Abstraction, object, component, and system levels
quiz.suggestion: Recall the different levels at which software can be reused

quiz.question: Which is a cost associated with software reuse?
options: Costs of adapting and configuring reusable software
Costs of marketing the final product
quiz.answer: Costs of adapting and configuring reusable software
quiz.suggestion: Review the different costs involved in software reuse

quiz.question: What is open-source development?
options: An approach where source code is published and volunteers contribute
A method where only paid developers can access the source code
A type of hardware design process
quiz.answer: An approach where source code is published and volunteers contribute
quiz.suggestion: Recall the definition of open-source development

quiz.question: Which of the following is an example of an open-source system?
quiz.answer: Linux operating system
quiz.suggestion: Recall examples of open-source software mentioned in the chapter

quiz.question: What is a common business model for open-source product companies?
options: Licensing the software under strict proprietary terms
quiz.answer: Selling support for the product
quiz.suggestion: Review the business models associated with open-source software

quiz.question: Which open-source license requires derived works to also be open-source?
quiz.answer: GNU General Public License (GPL)
quiz.suggestion: Recall the characteristics of different open-source licenses

quiz.question: What does the LGPL license allow?
options: Linking to open-source code without publishing the source of new components
Selling modified code without any restrictions
Using the code only in academic projects
Distributing the software only in binary form
quiz.answer: Linking to open-source code without publishing the source of new components
quiz.suggestion: Review the differences between GPL and LGPL licenses

quiz.question: Which of the following is an implementation issue discussed in the chapter?
quiz.answer: Configuration management
quiz.suggestion: Recall the key implementation issues highlighted

quiz.question: What is host-target development?
options: Developing on one computer and executing on another
Developing software for multiple operating systems
Using cloud servers for development and deployment
Writing code on the target hardware directly
quiz.answer: Developing on one computer and executing on another
quiz.suggestion: Review the concept of host-target development

quiz.question: What is the purpose of interface specification in object-oriented design?
options: To allow objects and components to be designed in parallel
To finalize the user interface design
quiz.answer: To allow objects and components to be designed in parallel
quiz.suggestion: Recall why interface specification is important

quiz.question: Which tool is an example of a testing tool in development platforms?
quiz.answer: JUnit
quiz.suggestion: Recall examples of development tools mentioned

quiz.question: What is a key principle of open-source licensing?
options: Source code should be freely available
Only the original developer can modify the code
The software cannot be used commercially
Users must pay a subscription fee
quiz.answer: Source code should be freely available
quiz.suggestion: Review the fundamental principle of open-source licensing

quiz.question: Which of the following is a benefit of open-source development?
quiz.answer: Rapid development through community contributions
quiz.suggestion: Recall the advantages of open-source development

quiz.question: What is a common challenge in object class identification?
options: It relies on skill, experience, and domain knowledge
It can be done automatically by tools
It is always straightforward and deterministic
quiz.answer: It relies on skill, experience, and domain knowledge
quiz.suggestion: Review the difficulties in identifying object classes

quiz.question: What is the role of configuration management during development?
options: Tracking different versions of software components
quiz.answer: Tracking different versions of software components
quiz.suggestion: Recall the purpose of configuration management

quiz.question: Which of the following is a reuse level that involves entire application systems?
quiz.answer: System level
quiz.suggestion: Recall the highest level of software reuse

quiz.question: What is a key activity in license management for open-source software?
options: Hiding the source code from users
Preventing any modifications to the code
Selling the software without a license
quiz.answer: Educating people about open source
quiz.suggestion: Review the recommendations for managing open-source licenses

quiz.question: Which design model is used to show the system's interactions with its environment?
quiz.answer: Use case diagrams
quiz.suggestion: Recall which UML diagram is used for interactions

quiz.question: What does the 'abstraction level' of reuse refer to?
options: Using knowledge of successful abstractions in design
Reusing individual objects from a library
Reusing collections of objects and classes
quiz.answer: Using knowledge of successful abstractions in design
quiz.suggestion: Recall the meaning of abstraction-level reuse

quiz.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical development platform tool?
quiz.answer: Marketing analysis software
quiz.suggestion: Recall the types of tools used in development platforms

quiz.question: What is a major advantage of using off-the-shelf systems (COTS)?
options: It can be cheaper and faster than custom development
It eliminates the need for design
quiz.answer: It can be cheaper and faster than custom development
quiz.suggestion: Review the benefits of using COTS

quiz.question: What is the focus of object-oriented design using UML?
options: Writing code in a specific programming language
quiz.answer: Developing several different system models
quiz.section: An object-oriented design process using the UML
quiz.suggestion: Recall the purpose of UML in object-oriented design

quiz.question: Which of the following is an example of an application domain object in the weather station system?
quiz.answer: Ground thermometer
quiz.suggestion: Recall the tangible objects identified in the weather station example

quiz.question: What does the BSD license allow?
options: Including open-source code in proprietary systems without republishing changes
Requiring all derived works to be open-source
Restricting commercial use of the software
Forbidding any modifications to the code
quiz.answer: Including open-source code in proprietary systems without republishing changes
quiz.suggestion: Recall the permissive nature of the BSD license

quiz.question: What is the purpose of system context and interaction models?
options: To understand the system's environment and how it interacts
To write the source code for the system
To design the user interface layout
quiz.answer: To understand the system's environment and how it interacts
quiz.suggestion: Recall the importance of context and interaction models

quiz.question: Which of the following is a challenge in software reuse?
options: Integrating reusable software elements from different sources
Finding developers to write new code
quiz.answer: Integrating reusable software elements from different sources
quiz.suggestion: Review the difficulties associated with software reuse

quiz.question: What is a key feature of open-source licensing?
options: Legal conditions are included to restrict use
The code is always free for any use without conditions
Only the original developer can use the code
quiz.answer: Legal conditions are included to restrict use
quiz.suggestion: Recall how open-source licenses impose conditions

quiz.question: Which activity is part of the object-oriented design process?
quiz.answer: Specify object interfaces
quiz.suggestion: Recall the stages in object-oriented design

quiz.question: What is the main goal of architectural design in the weather station example?
options: To identify major components and their interactions
To write the code for each sensor
To design the physical housing of the station
quiz.answer: To identify major components and their interactions
quiz.suggestion: Recall the purpose of architectural design in the example

quiz.question: Which tool helps organize code for different development projects?
quiz.answer: Project support tools
quiz.suggestion: Recall the function of project support tools

quiz.question: What does the 'component level' of reuse involve?
options: Reusing collections of objects and object classes
quiz.answer: Reusing collections of objects and object classes
quiz.suggestion: Recall the definition of component-level reuse

quiz.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of open-source business models?
options: Selling support services rather than the software itself
quiz.answer: Selling support services rather than the software itself
quiz.suggestion: Recall how companies profit from open-source software

quiz.question: What is the purpose of a use case description?
options: To detail interactions between actors and the system
To list all object classes in the system
quiz.answer: To detail interactions between actors and the system
quiz.suggestion: Recall the role of use case descriptions

quiz.question: Which of the following is an example of a configuration management activity?
quiz.answer: Tracking versions of software components
quiz.suggestion: Recall what configuration management involves

quiz.question: What is a key consideration in the 'Build or Buy' decision?
options: Whether existing systems can be adapted to meet requirements
The popularity of the programming language
The color scheme of the user interface
The age of the development team
quiz.answer: Whether existing systems can be adapted to meet requirements
quiz.suggestion: Recall the factors influencing the Build or Buy choice

quiz.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using open-source software?
options: Access to a large community of contributors and users
quiz.answer: Access to a large community of contributors and users
quiz.suggestion: Recall the advantages of open-source software

quiz.question: What is the role of interface specification in parallel development?
options: To allow different teams to work on objects simultaneously
To finalize the user interface design early
quiz.answer: To allow different teams to work on objects simultaneously
quiz.suggestion: Recall why interface specification enables parallel work

quiz.question: Which of the following is a challenge in open-source license management?
options: Understanding different license types and their implications
Preventing any use of the software
Ensuring the software is never modified
Keeping the source code completely hidden
quiz.answer: Understanding different license types and their implications
quiz.suggestion: Recall the complexities of managing open-source licenses

quiz.question: What is the primary focus when designing with off-the-shelf systems?
options: How to use configuration features to meet requirements
quiz.answer: How to use configuration features to meet requirements
quiz.suggestion: Recall the design focus when using COTS

quiz.question: Which of the following is NOT a level of software reuse?
quiz.answer: Documentation level
quiz.suggestion: Recall the four levels of software reuse

quiz.question: What is a key activity in open-source license management?
quiz.answer: Having auditing systems in place
quiz.suggestion: Recall the recommendations for managing open-source licenses effectively
